reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Not swanky, but you are made to feel welcomed and appreciated. A cozy onsite casino, just right for the size of the establishment, you won't feel lost in the glitz like the Big Name Place down the street. The gaming definitely felt more generous, I didn't feel taken advantage of to pay for all the high-end overhead. The on-site restaurant is a treasure, they pride themselves for their "from scratch" cooking, and I believe it. For breakfast, you can't go wrong with the biscuits and gravy! Jackpot is small, there are good sidewalks on each side of the road, and unless it's a howling blizzard, it's not a long walk to visit any or all of the town's other establishments. You need to walk off those biscuits and gravy, right?!?
reviews.title: Feel Like a Guest, and Not a Customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small, but clean, comfortable, and had everything needed for a decent night's stay. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The Prime Rib dinner was only $20 for a 16oz and $15 for a 12oz which included a potato, vegetable, and salad. It was one of the best Prime Ribs I've ever had. There is a shuttle available free of charge for a ride to any of the other casinos, but tipping the driver a dollar is a nice courtesy. If you're over 55, the rate for Sunday thru Thursday is only $25, but the weekend rate of $55 is very reasonable.
reviews.title: Best deal in Jackpot for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Four Jacks Hotel is by far the best value for your $$ in Jackpot. While the "big boys" have all the bells and whistles, there is a price to pay. Have stayed at Four Jacks for over 20 years, the last time (2009) was so bad that we swore never to come back. In April 2012 we again visited Jackpot and after seeing the "jacked up" prices we decided to try Four Jacks again. WOW, completely redone rooms, clean, quiet and well maintained. As an added surprise, free WiFi. Unless you plan to spend you entire stay in a hotel, save your lodging costs by staying at Four Jacks, you'll be glad you did.
reviews.title: You get MORE than you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel if you are in Jackpot. Great price and super room. Very clean. Dinner in the restaurant was very good. Very speedy check-in and faster check-out. Great service. What more could you want!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hae stayed at the Four Jacks several times, most recently 18 Jan. 2012
reviews.title: Best Deal in Jackpot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have often stayed at the Four Jack and found it very reasonable for price. The staff are friendly and the food is always good. Rooms are basic but clean. Internet is available. Will stay there again.
reviews.title: Recent stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze. The rooms were nice but the bathrooms were first class. (They need larger towels though). Cheep beer while you gamble, and not bad food. The Rib eye dinner was good as well as the breakfast the next morning. Overall i don't think you can beat it.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Booming voices in the hallway all night. No sleep in between 2 long days of driving. Staff did nothing... I think it may have been them making all the noise. Other guests are coming out into the hallway asking the people to be quiet and slamming doors.
reviews.title: So noisy it's impossible to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heading south toward Vegas, but getting toward stopping time? On a budget, to boot. There's Twin Falls. There's Wells, NV. Or you could do the Utah route on I-15. How about Jackpot! Except that for the budget minded, the two major casinos are pricey. Four Jacks offers a bargain price alternative. At less than $40 for a double, you get a really clean unit in an old fashioned hotel with lots of charm. A lot of folks have discovered it, as the parking lot by evening was pretty full, mostly older autos and a fair number of motorcycles. They even throw in a 25 cent brew at the bar. The restaurant is so-so. We had rib-eyes at a reasonable price. They were well-seasoned but kind of tough. There were lots of Mexican items on the menu. They might have been much better. However, we would suggest to management that the kitchen get a close look. Otherwise, customers might just go a few blocks north to the premier casinos for their meal. The casino side "invited" us to drop a few bucks on the slots, which we dutifully did. However, next morning we traveled south to Wells for breakfast at the casino on the left just before you cross under the Interstate. Good Breakfast, plus my significant other won fifteen bucks on Sex and the City, her favorite slot.
reviews.title: A great and affordable overnight stopping place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we were told that our reservation was at the old price and that it was now higher. I showed the confirmed reservation at the old price and it was honoured. We did not receive an upgraded room but at $30, why complain. The prime rib was basically bad, tough and gristlely. Bad not live up to other reviews but was OK for the price.rtender was quite freindly and the slots were very tight. 4J's di
reviews.title: Sadly, just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This place was ok.
reviews.title: Cheap rooms, not much else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very old, the toilet had a problem.
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino was one of the smallest I have ever seen. All it had were a few slot machines, and none of them appealed to me. Maybe this was for the best as I saved money by not gambling.
reviews.title: Nice roo, great staff, good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was very low, I think it was $29, so I didn't mind the shortcomings.
reviews.title: Newly redecorated - Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's tempting when driving to Jackpot to stay at the high end resort/casino places, except for their outrageous prices. We elected to try Four Jacks and I'm glad we did. Just a preface: this is my first review as I'm not that keen about doing reviews, but this gem of a place changed my mind.
reviews.title: Good Value - Great location enroute to Las Vegas, NV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jack and I love Four Jacks, Eldy and Derrick are awesome, won big money, free drinks, comped room, the dining room is sooooooooooo much better than across the street, just another day in paradise - you go Four Jacks!
reviews.title: Four Jacks, the only place to stay and play

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were travelling across the US (LA to Toronto Ontario) this past June (2012) on motorcycles. We stopped here for the night and received a recommendation for this hotel from a local person I had asked.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: The check in was fast and friendly. The $25 rate was for those 55+ however the check in clerk was willing to give us that rate. The regular rate was $32 so we went with that.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was upstairs and large. The bathroom had been obviously recently redone and there was a fridge in the room which was really helpful since we were carrying a cooler on one of the bikes.
reviews.title: Nice place, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking lot was level and paved. There was no pool on site but you could use the rec centre if need be. The only reason it was an issue for us was that we had been travelling in 100+ F weather with bike gear on. After a cool shower though all was good.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for $25!
